description.narrative: Enhancing conservation of globally significant biodiversity through protected area system strengthening in Gansu
seat of a third-order administrative division
seat of a first-order administrative division
seat of a fourth-order administrative division

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: Indicator 1: Number of direct project beneficiaries Indicator 2: Ecological corridors (EC) established and PA System expanded by more than 25,000 ha Indicator 3: Improvements in status of globally threatened species in Gansu Province as measured by: stable or increased populations of indicator species Indicator 4: Extent to which legal, policy and institutional frameworks reflect current national policy for biodiversity conservation Indicator 5: Revised provincial laws for wildlife conservation and NR management reflecting KBAs Indicator 6: Biodiversity conservation integrated as a mainstreamed task in the Provincial Five-Year Plan (FYP) Indicator 7: Improved institutional capacity to administer the provincial PA System and globally threatened species conservation, indicated by UNDP capacity development scorecard Indicator 8: PA system financing gap Indicator 9: Increased management effectiveness Indicator 10: Threats to biodiversity reduced at project demonstration sites Indicator 11: Extent of documentation and dissemination of project lessons learned Indicator 12: Improved awareness of the value of biodiversity conservation among key target groups

comment.narrative: 1. 0 2. Baseline area 2017: PA system: 10,033,410 ha 3. Baseline year is 2017. Source: Wang Yaolin (Annex O) 4. Five key biodiversity-related laws are out of date in relation to current national laws and require strengthening See PPG report in Annex R 5. Existing policy and legal framework is evolving but does not yet reflect KBAs or the need to include them in the PA system and EC network, no agency reporting requirement for status of KBAs and globally threatened species 6. The Outline of Gansu 13th FYP Chapter 17 describes key projects on NRs and wildlife conservation and key ecological function zones 7. 53%, 38% 57% repectively for Gansu Forestry Department, Bailongjiang Forestry Administration and Gansu Endangered Animal Protection Centre 8. The provincial PA system is centrally financed with little diversification of funding sources. PA system financing gap of USD 81,740,000 for basic management costs 9. 42%, 55%, 45%, 52% respectively for Axia, Chaganlgiang, Duoer and Yuhe NRs 10. Please find in Prodoc P79 11. 0 12. Baseline KAP status to be established in year 1 using methodology in Annex V

Output 1.1: Strengthened legal and enforcement framework for protection of globally threatened species and Key Biodiversity Areas (KBAs), with subsidiary regulations, and compliance monitoring and evaluation system Output 1.2: Provincial Biodiversity Strategy and Action Plan updated and biodiversity conservation integrated as a mainstreamed task for key sectors in the Provincial Five-Year Plan (FYP) with provision for enhanced protection of KBAs and globally threatened species Output 1.3: Provincial level plans for conservation, rehabilitation and reintroduction of priority globally threatened species Output 1.4: Assessments and plans completed for PA system functional integrity supported by an ecological corridor network for the province Output 1.5: Provincial PA system and threatened species conservation strengthened through capacity development, support for national park governance, introduction of professional competence standards, provision of training modules and technical support to the Gansu Endangered Animals Protection Centre Output 2.1: Development and expansion of the Protected Area and Ecological Corridor Network by over 25,000 ha, increasing coverage of KBAs and improving habitat connectivity Output 2.2: Strengthened coordination and management of the PA and ecological corridor network in the West Qinling – Minshan Mountains Output 2.3: Effective community co-management and engagement in PA management achieving livelihoods improvement and threat reduction Output 2.4: Pilot interventions to demonstrate mechanisms for the prevention, management and compensation of human-wildlife conflict (HWC) damage adjacent to PAs and Ecological Corridors Output 2.5: Development of a landscape scale biodiversity survey, monitoring and information system for West Qinling Mountains-Minshan Mountains demonstration area Output 3.1: Knowledge management is coordinated effectively through the GEF China – Protected Area Reform Programme Output 3.2: M&E system incorporating gender mainstreaming developed and implemented for adaptive project management

1. legal and institutional framework a) Gansu Provinces Implementation Measures of the Forest Law of the Peoples Republic of China was amended and approved. And the modification of national level’s laws has been included in this year’s legislation plan b) The project coordinated members of the BSAP task force to collect their feedback to the integration of the BSAP into their 14th FYPs, which has come to an end basically. c) Gansu endangered species gap analysis and PA planning development is being prepared by Tianshui City Longyou Environmental Conservation Association. d) Training i. Organized three training sessions targeting on different levels of staff in Gansu PA system and have improved the capacity of related agencies managing the PA system and threatened species in Gansu Province. ii. Gansu Yishan Yishui Center for Environmental and Social Development organized three training sessions targeting on different levels of PA system staff. A total of 251 person/times from PMU and related PA management agencies participated in the training and a total of 228 person/times from the community participated in the training. As a result, the accuracy rate of answer to questions is higher than 88% and satisfaction rate with course arrangements and lecturers is higher than 90%. iii. A’xia and Duo’er NR conducted a 7-day study visit to Sichuan and Shaanxi Province respectively. A total of 35 NR staff participated in the study visit. iv. The project participated in the project management capacity building workshop organized by UNDP in 2021 and shared its practice and experience regarding gender mainstreaming with all participants. e) Scoring of the institutional capacity to three agencies of GFGB, Gansu Bailongjiang Forestry Protection Center (BFPC) and Gansu Endanger Animal Protection Center (EAPC) indicated that, compared with the baseline level of 53%, 38% and 57%, the capacity scores of the three agencies have increased significantly to 69%, 66% and 73% respectively. f) The financial sustainability scorecard of Gansu PA system showed that, at mid-term, the score has increased to 57% from 42%. The PA system financing gap for basic management costs have reduced to USD51,383,976 compared with the baseline level of USD 81,740,000. These have provided essential legislation and policy basis for conservation of globally threatened species and KBAs in Gansu; The project has organized three training sessions targeting on different levels of staff in Gansu PA system and have improved the capacity of related agencies managing the PA system and threatened species in Gansu Province.
2. Public Participation, Activities and Sharing a) Attended the COP 15 and shared project newsletters and project progress with participants. b) Issued an official document for EAPC regarding the EAPC Conservation Activity Impact Assessment Report and the Species Re-Introduction Technical Consultation Report, which provided technical guidance for the conservation, research, and re-introduction of endangered species in the EAPC. c) the PMO shared Gansu Stories and Gansu Experience with C-PAR 6 online. d) The project video has been developed and was shown to all parties during the MTR, which achieved sound publicity effect. e) Organized publicity activities jointly with Ecology and Environment Department on related festivals to publicize knowledge on biodiversity conservation and the project to community residents and local schools. f) The project website serves as the main platform to release project information. Since operation of the website, activities conducted by PMO and PMUs have been timely updated in project website. g) The communication and publicity consultant developed three issues of project briefs in 2021. PMO printed the briefs and shared with stakeholders. Currently the fourth issue is being prepared. By hard efforts, the project has generated significant conservation effect after trying its best to improve their livelihoods, strengthen their relationships with NRs and reduce their reliance the threats to local eco-environment and protected species.
3. Mountains Protection a) The biodiversity planning consultant submitted the improved West Winling-Min Mountain Landscape EC Network Implementation Plan, which the report has been approved. b) The mid-term METT scoring of the four target NRs (A’xia, Duo’er, Yuhe, Chagangliang) showed that, compared with baseline score of 42%, 45%, 52% and 55%, their scores have seen an increased to 53%, 57%, 68% and 65%. c) With support from the project, the four target NRs have developed their Financing Plan, which have passed expert review and been used to inform their work. d) The OA system of the project has been put into operation, which facilitated project staff during October to November due to outbreak of COVID-19 and ensure smooth implementation of project activities. e) The project commissioned Sichuan Zhiya Technology Co., Ltd. to develop the technical plan for Gansu PA biodiversity conservation information system, which has provided technical base for development of this IS. f) Four target NRs signed community resources co-management agreements with local communities, which effectively alleviated the relationship between NRs and local communities and contributed to reducing the community’s impact to local environment. g) The project commissioned Gansu Shichuang Culture Media Co., Ltd. for building the marketing capacity of community. By end of October 2021, the sales volume of tea has increased to 3,480 kg compared with 2,635 kg in 2019 and the annual sales has increased to RMB1,327,000 compared with that of RMB1,032,000 in 2019. h) The project commissioned Tianshui City Longyou Environmental Conservation Association to undertake the task of PA community eco-tourism implementation plan preparation and capacity building. Through the training, community people have initially mastered the tourist reception ability; i) Four target NRs and their local community jointly applied for the SGPs to support the development of alternative livelihoods by local community. Currently the communities are conducting relevant activities designed for the SGPs. j) The project commissioned Gangri Neichog Research and Conservation Center for the West Qinling – Min Mountains HWC management demonstration project. Relevant prevention facilities have been installed in place and have generated certain effect. k) The HWC Prevention Program and the HWC Prevention Manual have been finalized. After introducing the objective, scope, methodology and preparations to be made, PMUs have obtained a preliminary understanding of the MTR and have commenced preparation. 4. M&E a) Organized and participate in 27 meetings, workshops and discussions b) Organized 9 trainings regarding skill improvement and NR management, etc c) During the visits to project sites, PMO, project consultants and service providers organized 26 meetings. d) improved the Environmental and Social Impact Assessment (ESIA), which has been approved by the international consultant and sent to UNDP for review. e) The social inclusion consultant conducted SAPA training and assessment and introduced the concept and approached of SAPA. f) Issued two letters to assure that the project will not support voluntary or involuntary resettlement or any related activities remain in compliance with UNDP’s Social and Environmental Standards (SES). g) The project actively participated in the Time for Nature – UNDP teenager video work collection activity organized by UNDP. Two video works of Gansu project were exhibited through new media platform and UNDP microblog and received sound feedback. h) According to the MTR report generated in 2021, overall performance of the project is rated as “satisfactory”.

Activity 1.1 Effective governance and legal framework of Gansu PA system - provincial level plan approved and technical specifications allow establishment of new PA category suitable to biodivesity conservation Activity 1.2 FYP of key agencies recognize biodiversity conservation including key biodiversity area and globally threatened species Activity 1.3 Strengthen and improve the law and regulation framework of Gansu PA system Activity 1.4 Conduct assessment for PA system functional integrity and EC network and develop the PA and EC network plan of the province Activity 1.5 Provincial level PA database and information system established Activity 2.1 Orepare a series of plans, assessment and technical support to serve as the basis for establishment and expansion of PA and EC network in West Qinling Mountains-Minshan Mountains Landscape, and maintain close coordination with the PA and species conservation plan of the province Activity 2.2 In terms of coordination, capacity development, planning and monitoring activities of PA and EC network of West Qinlin and Minshan Mountains, apply simplified approaches to capacity development and conservation activities Activity 2.3 Establish village level proejct committees in demonstration community of target NRs to support implementation of co-management agreements and sustainable livelihoods to fully involve women and empower women Activity 2.4 In collaboration with stakeholders and partners, develop and test participatory approaches based on community to prevent and manage the loss from crops and livestock due to HWC Activity 2.5 evelop and test a pilot GIS-based information system to support PA management and biodiversity monitoring in demonstration landscape network Activity 3.1 Knowledge management system and capacity of GFGB strengthened Activity 3.2 Coordinate implementation, monitoring and evaluation of the project through C-PAR/C-PAR national project, as well as coordinated project results

During this reporting period, the project established the Project Steering Committee (PSC), and Project Management Offices (PMOs) were established at all levels. The project organized training for three times; The project held the Inception Workshop (IW) and the first PSC meeting in May; 8 national consultants were recruited by end of August. So far, the local environmental legal and policy specialist and the local PA sustainable financing specialist’s legislation proposal regarding the Regulations on Environmental Protection in Gansu Province (Draft) has been adopted by the Provincial People’s Congress; The project has accomplished the procurement of office equipment at provincial level and the establishment of project website. The procurement of other technical services are now undergoing. The project has developed two issues of project newsletter, participated in the IW of the China – Protected Area Reform (C-PAR) program in Beijing, and held discussions with Nature Reserves (NR) and surrounding communities for 8 times. So far, the total beneficiaries of the project are 464, including 323 men and 143 women with a female ratio of 30.82%; and the amount of ethnic minorities is 66, with a participation ratio of 14.22%. During this reporting period, the delivery rate of the grant transferred to project account is 90.8%, and the delivery rate of the fund allocated by UNDP is 54%, and the delivery rate of total annual budget is 40%.

Output 1.1: Strengthened legal and enforcement framework for protection of globally threatened species and Key Biodiversity Areas (KBAs), with subsidiary regulations, and compliance monitoring and evaluation system Output 1.2: Provincial Biodiversity Strategy and Action Plan updated and biodiversity conservation integrated as a mainstreamed task for key sectors in the Provincial Five-Year Plan (FYP) with provision for enhanced protection of KBAs and globally threatened species Output 1.3: Provincial level plans for conservation, rehabilitation and reintroduction of priority globally threatened species Output 1.4: Assessments and plans completed for PA system functional integrity supported by an ecological corridor network for the province Output 1.5: Provincial PA system and threatened species conservation strengthened through capacity development, support for national park governance, introduction of professional competence standards, provision of training modules and technical support to the Gansu Endangered Animals Protection Centre Output 2.1: Development and expansion of the Protected Area and Ecological Corridor Network by over 25,000 ha, increasing coverage of KBAs and improving habitat connectivity Output 2.2: Strengthened coordination and management of the PA and ecological corridor network in the West Qinling – Minshan Mountains Output 2.3: Effective community co-management and engagement in PA management achieving livelihoods improvement and threat reduction Output 2.4: Pilot interventions to demonstrate mechanisms for the prevention, management and compensation of human-wildlife conflict (HWC) damage adjacent to PAs and Ecological Corridors Output 2.5: Development of a landscape scale biodiversity survey, monitoring and information system for West Qinling Mountains-Minshan Mountains demonstration area Output 3.1: Knowledge management is coordinated effectively through the GEF China – Protected Area Reform Programme Output 3.2: M&E system incorporating gender mainstreaming developed and implemented for adaptive project management

Since launch of the project on May 13th, 2019, although some difficulties have been encountered in the implementation process, satisfactory progress has been achieved with the joint efforts of all parties. The project has been carrying out activities in an orderly manner in accordance with the TYWP and quarterly work plan approved by UNDP. By integrating the original subcontracting services designed in the Project Document, PMO formed a total of 26 technical service subcontracts. By December 31st, 2020, tasks of five contracts have been accomplished, tasks of 16 contracts are being implemented, 2 contracts will be signed in recently and 3 contracts will be signed after a bidding process. Aside from subcontracts, tasks under each component have been carried out according to work plan. Currently, the project has generated a dozen of results. Progress under each component is detailed in the table. Many activities under component 1 have progressed well. Gansu Province Biodiversity Conservation Strategy and Action Plan (2020-2030) (hereinafter referred to as the Strategy) has been finalized. The project is working on the official release of the strategy and integration of its key contents into the 14th Five Year Plan of provincial departments. The legislation proposals of the project regarding the Regulations on Environmental Protection in Gansu Province (Draft) has been adopted by Provincial People’s Congress; Through several rounds of bidding process, the project has selected the appropriate service provider for Gansu Provincial endanger species habitat gap analysis and Ecological Corridor (EC) and PA system planning. The project has established Gansu Province biodiversity conservation strategy and action plan and integration into the 14th Five Year Plan task force (hereinafter referred to as the Strategy task force) and Gansu Province biodiversity conservation law and policy task force (hereinafter referred to as the law task force) at provincial level through coordination and organized the first task force meeting. Technical report regarding Endangered Animal Protection Center (EAPC) have been finalized.
